ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Working through labs individually--covers computer programming, electronic circuitry, Raman spectrometry, and vacuum systems. I would recommend--builds independence in lab and working with materials not used often in previous Chemistry labs.

Any student that wants a better understanding of physical chemistry and the tools used in the study thereof would benefit from taking this class. The class introduces students to computer coding,electronics, laser spectroscopy, and vacuums. Along with building code and circuit boards, one learns how to connect the theory pounded into us in other classrooms to physical experiments and observations. The only word of warning I have is that 560L is a huge time commitment.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I learned just how connected theory and observation are. I was introduced to many new tools this past semester; I had never coded or used an oscilloscope or taken apart a vacuum. I now have confidence in approaching these tools.
